experiments.title: Periodicities
experiments.description: Aligning to start and end of timeframes that matter. What emerges as patterns from data? What emerges from a conversation about what matters?

experiments.title: Birdseye view of the company
experiments.description: An intelligent dashboard, customized to the viewer (MoMA++, for Google alums).

experiments.title: Quick archive
experiments.description: Send anything to Pi (email forward, Slack DM, drop into Pi chat) and tell it where to go, and it puts it into a form that can be saved to that spot in Google Drive.

experiments.title: Off the Record mode
experiments.description: Be able to start and end a conversation with the LLM without it remembering your inputs to recall later on, but with it still remembering who you are and your preferences.

experiments.title: Crowdsourcery
experiments.description: LLM connects you with internal experts or people that otherwise have accounts of a particular role with a particular product/service.

experiments.title: Who's in charge?
experiments.description: LLM helps you find people with the right access control to make changes to things AND the right chain of command for requesting it.

experiments.title: Known unknowns
experiments.description: What areas of the business data seem to be missing? How to fill the holes of insufficient data and understand what's missing.

experiments.title: Let's pretend
experiments.description: Have the LLM give us an ongoing reminder of who they are pretending to be when they respond.

experiments.title: Confidence
experiments.description: Explore which ways the LLM can indicate confidence based on reproducibility/traceable sources of responses.

experiments.title: The AI doesnâ€™t know
experiments.description: In low confidence cases, can it suggest other directions of higher confidence?

experiments.title: This is fine
experiments.description: Can it express judgment about whether an input reflects something normal (and context of what normal means), or something abnormal (and next steps to investigate)?

experiments.title: Who's who?
experiments.description: Generate an ad-hoc historical org chart over time (group people by function) based on artifacts in intranet, kinda like band timelines in Wikipedia.

experiments.title: Cohorts/frequency distribution of Pi users
experiments.description: Analyze usage patterns to understand user cohorts and frequency distribution.
